body:
Comment 4: 
> ... how can I programmatically disable UAC? 

I don't know, but I google for it. Best link I see is:

http://www.tipandtrick.net/ways-to-disable-or-turn-off-user-account-access-control-uac-in-windows-vista/

I would use "Method 2 – Disable UAC Using Registry Editor" or "Method 5 – Disable
User Access Control from Command Prompt". You could also use Go to modify registry. We
have some registry manipulating code in time/zoneinfo_windows.go and
mime/type_windows.go. Unfortunately both just do the reads. Or you can pinch some of my
code from http://godoc.org/code.google.com/p/winsvc/registry - it is very primitive,
but, I think, it should do the trick. I can write a program for you, if you like.

> Is there some command line tool I can run? 

Use "Method 5 – Disable User Access Control from Command Prompt" as mentioned above.
Perhaps there are others.

> Some registry setting? 

It looks like a register setting. See above.

> Does it require rebooting?

I don't know, but I am certain it would. It would even probably prompt you, before it
will let you change the registry. (another link I've found
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/682182/disabling-uac-programmatically)

Alex
